website_summaries.verdict: This electric burr grinder is definitely a step up from standard blades, though it doesn't give the same results as a higher-end burr grinder.
pros: Electric burr grinder with 17 grind selections
Choose from fine espresso to coarse French press
Quantity control dial lets you select from 2 to 12 cups
Hopper holds one cup of beans
cons: May not get as coarse as French press users like or as fine as espresso drinkers need to brew

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for French press grind.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this has so many good reviews. I was very excited to try this, as my old grinder is wearing out. The coarse setting on the Secura produces powder, not granules, for a French press. The thing is a pain to clean, and I have been cleaning appliances for a long time. The exit channel from grinder to bin jams easily with powder backed up, and the little brush that comes with it cannot get all the residue out of the way. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Crone

customer_reviews.title: Best Grinder Ever
customer_reviews.text: I go through a lot of coffee makers and grinders. Recently my latest grinder died so I was in the market for a new one. This grinder is by far the best grinder I have ever owned. Not only does it grind a perfect measure for a pot of coffee but also very quiet. My last grinder could of woken the dead which was particularly annoying at 6:00 am. Plus even though it had the pre-measured option for grinding beans, it was never consistent so ultimately I gave up and measured by scoop into the coffeemaker every morning. This one is always spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Maryrose90

customer_reviews.title: Product performed as described. Also did not have any ...
customer_reviews.text: Product performed as described. Also did not have any mess as some of the other people have described. I believe that this happens if the grounds collector box is not seated properly. Update 11/22/17 Had a problem with grinder would only grind coarsely. Call Secura Customer service and they shipped out a replacement. That easy and that is what I call customer service. Bravo Secura. New grinder works great and only took three business days from contact to receive new one.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: It grinds coffee, but without any varying degree of coarseness
customer_reviews.text: Returned because it didnt work as it should: The grind is the same regardless of setting. I purchased as an upgrade to blade grinder expecting to get an even grind at at least more than one setting. With this machine, no matter where you set the dial between coarse and espresso it comes out fine. Some people complain about the powder and the mess, but this should be expected with any grinder. The real problem with this is that it doesn't do what it is supposed to do: provide consistent sized grounds of variable size. Basically its pointless and I went back to blade grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C

customer_reviews.title: Our coffee is terrible as a result
customer_reviews.text: This grinder just doesn’t work the way it is supposed to. It will not grind coffee beans any way but very course. The grinding adjustment does not make any difference. The directions appear as though the grinding wheel can be removed, but it is impossible to remove it. Our coffee is terrible as a result. I think I waited too long to return it. It’s been about 5 months. During that time we have tried everything we could to get it to grind our beans less course, but to no avail. Very disappointed. We are wanting to purchase a burr grinder that works, but this experience has discouraged us from online purchases of this nature again.
customer_reviews.author: Whit Woodard

customer_reviews.title: It works well,
customer_reviews.text: It works well, is keeping up with us (We are a coffee drinking household with at least to pots a day) and is a little less noisier than our last grinder. As for the static issue, with all that friction going on during the grinding process, unless it was made of metal or grounded, I think that it would be a problem with all plastic grinders so that was not a deciding factor for me (I would rate that "static" at a normal amount). I was more concerned with weight and price
customer_reviews.author: Average shopper

customer_reviews.title: Supreme waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, don't buy this thing. The settings are basically for decoration. There is no such thing as "coarse" or "fine" when it comes to this coffee grinder, there is simply an outcome that consists partially of coffee dust, partially of coarse ground coffee and largely of whole, unground beans and large bean fragments. Also, I bough this thing about a year and a half ago and it just died. Supreme waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie Awad

customer_reviews.title: Nice little grinder
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying this grinder for about 5 weeks now and it works great. I used to have the Mr. Coffee coffee grinder (and still using one at work). Compared to it this grinder is much quieter. Some have commented about the "coffee dust" and mess. I had the same issue with the Mr. Coffee grinder (even the professional coffee grinders at the grocery stores create coffee dust). Also, the Secura doesn't get clogged with beans and have to be shaken like the Mr. Coffee. Overall, my only wish would be a bigger hopper so I can grind more than one pot before refilling. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: donmo40

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 6 months now, although I quit using it about a month ago out of irritation (and went back to my ancient Braun blade-grinder). I guess it grinds coffee beans OK, but there's no way to get the ground material out of it without making a fairly big mess on the counter. To be honest, I picked it because it was one of the less expensive burr-grinder models, but seemed to have decent reviews, so I made the purchase -- and now mostly regret it. Guess you only get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: Martin M.

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews for this grinder, I chose to purchase it because it seemed like an excellent value point, and indeed it is. It is convenient, it does an excellent job metering the amount of grounds being made, and after a few weeks of daily use I can say that it is reliable. The major negative to me is that it can be a little messy; I grind mainly espresso, and the fine powder tends to scatter about no matter how careful I am removing the bin. I do not use french press coffee, so I don't worry about the grind variability that has generated some negative reviews. All in all I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, silent, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I got hooked on Nespresso machines while traveling a few years back, and now we use them all the time. While the coffee is superb, it's an expensive habit. So, we invested in some reusable pods and this grinder to make our own. While we've not yet found the type of bean we like best, the grinder is an excellent piece of kitchen equipment. Nearly silent, it does it's magic quickly and is very easy to operate. We use the finest settings for the Nespresso pods, and the coffee comes out nice and powdery, as it should. The unit is also easy to clean, which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: After some practice with the settings we found the grind and cup setting we prefer. Works well. A couple weeks later. While we continue to enjoy the results produced by this grinder I must advise that it is difficult to get the coffee from the grinder without leaving ground coffee bean particles in the work area and on the grinder itself because all the bean particles do not make it into the container. Coffee also accumulates in the chute from the grinder and can be difficult to remove without making a mess.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great value for the price! I’ve been using it several times a week for about the last year and it still works like new! It’s actually quieter than the big name brand burr mill it replaced. It does leave some finer grind in the process, but so did my last name brand, so this doesn’t bother me, I think it just comes with the process, and I’m very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: krisc

customer_reviews.title: It's a good grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great little grinder with lots of options. You can set the number of cups from 2 to 24 and you can set the fineness of the grind. The fineness of the grind I was a little disappointed in it only has 5 setting which isn't much but it does great for what I wanted it for which is to grind coffee. If you set it on the finest grind you'll get very fine dust so I wouldn't suggest it. Over all a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Risenheart Consulting

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine.
customer_reviews.text: I like both drip & pressed coffee. Used to always use a bladed grinder and grind was hit & miss. This grinder has 14 levels of grind & a timer to grind beans for 2 to 12 cups of coffee. Some reviews say the grind is inconsistent. To my eye, the grind is adequate (especially for the price). Transferring the grind to another container can be slightly messy as the cup is plastic and static causes the grind to dispense unpredictably. It's simple, effective and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Dale the builder

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: The adjustment settings are way too fine even at the coarsest setting. I had to take it apart at one point because it seized up from the fine powder, so I took the opportunity to move the gear plate to make it more coarse for our coffee maker and for cold brew. It's been working fine since then, but definitely not something I should've had to do. Overall, the worst burr grinder I've used, and will definitely be upgrading in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JoeTheOak

customer_reviews.title: Starts Out Fine But Over Time Is Only Coarse
customer_reviews.text: Like another review I just saw, this grinder began well but over time lost its ability to produce anything but coarse grinds. I took it apart last weekend and gave it a really good cleaning including each burr, but it made very little difference. Pretty obvious that after less than a year of moderate use, the unit has worn down to the point where I need to get another. The only bright spot in this after it's kicked the grinding fine bucket is that I got it on Black Friday so I didn't spend a ton.
customer_reviews.author: M Ricci

customer_reviews.title: some would be fine powder, some maybe a few whole beans left ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I had know idea the difference a grinder can make, our old grinder, some would be fine powder, some maybe a few whole beans left in it, a combination of fine dust and very course grind. Now all are consistent, perfect. Course for the French Press, and normal for the coffee maker. This had made better coffee! there is a trial and error period you go thru, or be sure and read your bean bag directions guys, we have tried 3 different types of whole bean coffee, and all 3 are different grinds. they say grind as you go, so thats what I do, kinda loud but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Jon

customer_reviews.title: The only grinder you need
customer_reviews.text: This was the first purchase I made after buying my first house. So glad I went with this and not something that might disappoint me. Like a girlfriend with daddy issues or a '96 Honda Accord LX with a questionable sunroof. Fantastic product. Does exactly what you set it to. Great crush and just the right amount of aroma release. Easily cleaned and looks great next to my jet black Brahms coffee maker. 10/10 would grind!
customer_reviews.author: John R Pyburn

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Junk. It only grinds one type no matter the setting: Dust. Unfortunately did not work for my drip coffee maker. Thought, for the price, I was buying a decent grinder. It was discounted also, but should not have been sold, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen F

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in everyway!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Burr compact sized coffee grinder that also had good reviews and this was it! It's a perfect size to leave out on the counter but more than that it grinds the beans well, easy top load for the beans, the adjustments are well located and grounds container is an easy access with no mess. I like everything about this grinder! I keep my beans in the freezer to retain freshness, so I like the small size. A full hopper of beans gives me two days of making an 8 cup grind.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Kepler

customer_reviews.title: I was able to successfully grind about two servings of ...
customer_reviews.text: I was able to successfully grind about two servings of finely ground coffee for a cone filter, but then wanted to use the grinder five minutes later, and it was completely dead. Tried cleaning the grinder and the other parts, but the grinder never turned back on. No buzzing or other noise, just silence. Sent back to Amazon for a full refund after one day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Veilleux

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little coffee grinder. I bought it because I purchased coffee from Amazon that I thought was ground but when received, it was beans. I needed a coffee grinder and didn't want a blade one. For the price, compared to other burr grinders, this has worked great. I now only buy coffee beans and the coffee has been better than ever! I like the fact that I can grind coffee to the consistency I want and am not limited to ground size in packaged ground coffee.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: grind size is horribly not uniform
customer_reviews.text: Pro: aesthetically pleasing, big holding bin, push to grind button. Con: large oil build up in gears that need cleaned frequently, grind size is horribly not uniform, and the gears get jammed easily when switching grind size. All in all, I would suggest a different product!
customer_reviews.author: Heath Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder does a very nice job of grinding beans. I usually take a whole pound of ground coffee to work for my French press, so I grind a lot all at once. This handles that well. My chief complains are that it is not easy to clean out and the static from the grinds causes them to stick to the container making it even more difficult to clean out. There is often a small pile of grinds on the counter when I'm done - but remember I'm grinding almost a full kilo at a time.
customer_reviews.author: nadler369

customer_reviews.title: No consistency
customer_reviews.text: There is no point in changing the setting for how fine you want it to grind, because regardless of whee you put it it grinds the same, a mixture of chunks and powder. Impossible to clean and very messy as the opening for the coffee to come out of the grinder gets backed up and when you remove the ground coffee chamber, the backed up coffee falls all over the counter. If you don't care about the mess and a specific grind size is not important to you, then get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grounds All Over
customer_reviews.text: This grinder does a great job. The only problem I have is when I use it grounds end up all over the place. After the coffee pot is empty, I have to completely wash the pot. M solution to this problem is to move the grinder next to the kitchen sink and place the part that holds the grounds in the sink for filling. After using the grinder at the kitchen sink, spreading of the grounds is minimized. I have become discouraged with the mess this grinder generates and am replacing it. In addition the plastic receiving bin is breaking up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as advertised. I use it to prepare refillable K-cups for my daily brew. I start the brewer, and as it warms up, I push one button on the front of the Secura. It grinds the exact amount of coffee necessary for one mug of coffee (it takes a tiny bit of experimentation to determine the exact setting for both the grind level - coarse through fine - and the proper amount to grind to fill the K-cup), I dump it into the refillable, place it in the brewer, and it's perfect. One button operation is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: P. Palmisano

customer_reviews.title: The Little Grinder that Could
customer_reviews.text: A great little grinder that gets the job done fast, easy, and with very little cleanup. Also takes up very little countertop space. Holds lots of beans so I don't have to keep refilling. I keep mine set on the 4 cups setting for use with my Aeropress coffee maker and get just the right amount for what I consider to be 2 shots of "espresso" every time. Very consistent grind in both volume and granules. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Beaty, Author of the SMART FOCUS series

customer_reviews.title: Precise, efficient, easily operated, adult person's coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: IT WORKS!!! When home ground, almost any whole bean coffee is superior to coffee you buy already ground, BUT, if you've been saving a stash of exotic imported whole bean for a special occasion, today's the day to realize that EVERY DAY IS A SPECIAL OCCASION and you deserve rich, satisfying coffee EVERY DAY! After years of a parade of so-so coffee grinders and the grinder adapters for my full size blender and reading the manufacturer's product information and customers' reviews, I ordered this Secura.
customer_reviews.author: PHOEBE HOPPER

customer_reviews.title: My Honest Opinion
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever coffee grinder, I bought it 7/ 2018. I read & watched many reviews, before I bought it, & not sure why some don't like it. Its not top shelf, but dose the job & has not fail yet, I use it 3-5 days a week. For the price, its not going to do the dishes & walk the dog lol. I gave it 4 stars because its a little messy & noisy for 4 am. I recommend it to anyone that is a first time buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Passport

customer_reviews.title: Messy and inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: It is messy. the plastic bin is statically charged so the grounds semi adhere to the bin. then when you remove the bin it gets the grounds everywhere. The coffee beans get stuck in the hopper requiring a manual manipulation of the grinding wheel to get it un-jammed which negates the whole point of it being "automatic" and makes for inconsistent coffee grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: it does work fine. As with my previous burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: Almost all of the parts are plastic, so I worry about the longevity of this grinder. I have only had it for a couple of weeks so far, and so far, it does work fine. As with my previous burr grinder, it is rather messy when you transfer grounds from the grinder tray into the coffee filter. This grinder is far less noisy than my previous grinder which is nice. And at about a third of the price, so far I would have to say that I am NOT disappointed with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Grinder is not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: The coffee grinder did not come with any instructions on which settings to use for fine, course, etc. I experimented with the different settings and every one of them produced a fine powder (somewhat like baby powder). I could not get a coarse grind or any other kind of grind either. I would not recommend anyone purchasing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ken E Gilpatric

customer_reviews.title: A decent burr grinder for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: As the description states: A decent burr grinder for a decent price Nice and compact, looks good on my counter, works even better at grinding my beans, and does so quickly Coming from a blade grinder I can say that this grinder does a great job at producing a consistent coarse grind for my french press. All in all this was a solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Popper

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a few months now. Love the fact that you just adjust the timer (dosage) dial and it grinds you exactly 14grams of coffee ( you need to play with it the first day to get the right amount you need) for your double shot espresso every morning :) No more, no less, just what you need :)
customer_reviews.author: Yavor Ivanov

customer_reviews.title: Good but not Great
customer_reviews.text: I like this product and I use it all the time to grind my coffee but I have to admit that it is messy. There seems to be no way to pull out the ground coffee without getting coffee dust all over the counter. To be fair I think this is just a common problem in coffee grinders but I’d love to have one that was clean and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Lori Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: No matter how you set the grinder you get one grind. It makes a terrible mess even though I hold the grounds receiving container tight to the machine. The coffee comes out from the side of unit instead of straight down. The shute becomes packed with ultrafine grounds but the grind is chunky.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Osika

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffee grinder. I have used a MUCH more expensive burr coffee grinder and this one is equal, if not superior. It has a large reservoir compartment (where beans go through the burr grinder) which closes securely. It grinds up to 12 cups at a time. Depending on the type of coffee and coarseness of the grind, some static cling can happen and can get a bit messy. However, I don't have an issue with my brand of coffee. There is hardly any mess to clean up. Every once in a while, I will brush off the accumulated fine grind from the opening from the grinder to the container. Really an excellent product, especially for its price point. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: baabaablu

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This grinder produces a very consistent ground size which is great. However, the position of the expelled hole means that every-time you take the grounds container out a little coffee falls to the bottom back of the platform that holds to the ground container. Which prevents the grounds container from fitting back into place. It's not a big deal, it's just a minor inconvenience at 6 am.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Adjustment ring is stuck - like it's fused to something
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for just over 1 year, of course. The adjustment ring started getting very difficult to turn. It's stuck on a very coarse grind so it is NOT grinding properly. Today the adjustment ring will not turn at all. It's like ti welded or fused. It wil not turn, not with my hand, not with a cloth over the grinder. It's just stuck tight. How come these items work for just over the warranty limit?
customer_reviews.author: Tony Marino

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy this burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy this burr grinder. Nice selection of grinds for a drip coffee maker. For what its worth - I am not one to read manuals however, I found two points in this manual I'd like to share. It states - change the grind adjustment wheel when the appliance is operating and secondly, "0" is for a coarse grind and "4" is for a fine grind. I believe this contradicts the two "grind" pictures that are displayed on the grinder. So, to find your ideal grind, make sure appliance is running and, use the numbers and ignore the pictures Or, if you are a picture person, make sure appliance is running and "flip-flop" the pictures to find your ideal grind..
customer_reviews.author: Glen K.

customer_reviews.title: This allows me to spend 10 seconds in the morning to grind fresh beans for a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily. I got tired of buying a big bag of fresh beans only having to grind them up in advance before I actually use them. This allows me to spend 10 seconds in the morning to grind fresh beans for a great cup of coffee. Burr grinders are better than the standard coffee grinder too.
customer_reviews.author: bv_amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Grater-style coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Starter grinder. This is not a ceramic conical grinder. It works more like a high speed grater. The bin cracks. be sure not to help the cracks along. Replacement bins do the same. After more than a year it is still working, but the timer for my portion has gone from 2.3 to 4 ticks. I'm not sure how long it will take to do my grind next year.
customer_reviews.author: John A Nees

customer_reviews.title: Very good grinder for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Secura grinder is a fine product for the money. It grinds across a wide range and it's coffee catcher is large enough to grind for a number of brewing cycles or you can, after some experimentation, set it to grind just enough for one use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I use this grinder for COFFEE...espresso, French press, regular. The burr grinder makes the perfect grounds for each. it also allows me to grind the right amount for the cups I wish to make. I love it . If there was any way this product could be improved it'd be to have retractable cord for better cord storage. Can you work on that? The price was right for the functions.
customer_reviews.author: mmaclise

customer_reviews.title: Messy and poor setting range
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this grinder for well over a year now. It does an OK job but has some draw backs. Design makes a mess of ground coffee. After you grind the coffee and remove the container from the grinder, coffee spills from the grinder and from the container onto the counter. In addition, the grind are adjustments are basically...very very fine to slightly coarse. The highest coarse setting produces pretty "fine" grounds. Not a lot of variation from lowest to highest setting.
customer_reviews.author: BobSmi

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this grinder
customer_reviews.text: I measure out 1/4 cup Italian Roast beans and 1/4 cup low acid beans, do a medium grind, use real cream and stevia for sweetener. This makes me a brew that has some punch to it, but not bitter. It took me a long time to figure out this formula! The grinder does it's job quickly. I use an electric drip machine by Mr. Coffee. Very satisfied with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin K. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Use this grinder to prepare small amounts of ground coffee as my supply dwindles. Use about a third of a1 lb bag of coffee beans at a time and store the ground coffee in a sealed container. Works quite well and the grinder is perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.author: George aka the bear

customer_reviews.title: A good find... update
customer_reviews.text: Update: Secura was very prompt in getting me a replacement unit and providing return shipping tor the defective unit. Initially it worked well (about 2 weeks). Now the grinder keeps working its way out of place. I'm currently working with Secura, will update my review after getting their support. Works well, looks good and well-priced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Secura SCG-903B Automatic Burr Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: A great automatic burr coffee bean grinder. A well designed product with a range of grind settings to achieve the desired coffee strength for individual preferences. The product is competitively priced and with its array of features out performs more expensive machines. This is a superior product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D. Sternstein

customer_reviews.title: A delightful machine.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Easy to adjust and the grind is consistent and the result is delicious coffee. 1 part coffee to 7 parts of water will create a perfect cup of coffee, but that has nothing to do with the ginger :-)
customer_reviews.author: Danwood

customer_reviews.title: What a great little grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy that I took a chance on this grinder. It powers through my beans quickly, produces a grind that is precisely what I want and I especially like the way the container that holds the grounds fits around the chute -- I have less dust or lost ground than I have ever had with any coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Koziczkowski

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I was in Hawaii and bought some wonderful pure Kona coffee to make my Cold Brew at home with. Unfortunately I did not have a proper grinder. My son told me about this one that he uses and sent me the link. I absolutely love this grinder!! It is perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, but not that great. Worked ok when I first got it, although the dial to adjust the grind size was always hard to move. But today, the grind was large even though it was set on small. Moving the grind size dial (with difficulty) had know effect. Then it started making a weird sound. I cleaned it thoroughly, still stuck on large grind size. Unfortunately the retn period ended last week. I have to get a new grinder AND I'm out $35.
customer_reviews.author: nan e. wilson

customer_reviews.title: its like it "shaves" the beans with a high-speed blade
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how they consider this a burr grinder. More than grinding, its like it "shaves" the beans with a high-speed blade. Grind settings only go from super fine texture to an even more fine powder, so it works ok for espresso, but not pour over or french press. Unfortunately, it also burns the beans a bit because of the high speed blade (the groundbeans actually come out hot). I bought this to replace my broken kitchenaide burr grinder. This one is of course much less expensive so it's not a fair comparison, but this also is not going to give you true burr ground texture.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Arvidson

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: I received it 120V But on box 220V My electric 220 V
customer_reviews.author: Sulaiman

customer_reviews.title: Usable,
customer_reviews.text: You have to keep turning a knob to make it finish grinding. Hard in my old hand. It doesn’t fully clean out. It makes a mess on my counter when transferring The ground coffee. Wish I had my old simple GE grinder, but it’s not made anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Marie B

customer_reviews.title: Good budget grinder.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder definitely gets the job done well, especially for the price. I had to do some experimenting with the courseness/fineness level before getting the consistency of grounds that I wanted. It plows through beans like a champ, although you do have to shake it sometimes throughout to get the beans back into the feed. Machine is definitely loud, so you probably don't want to grind early in the AM if you're an apartment dweller like myself. Otherwise, this is a great little grinder for the price and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Burlingame

customer_reviews.title: Messy Grinder with No Grind Adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Used product for couple months with no problem. Side feed of ground product is messy and wasteful. Adjusted for fine grind, which it did, then would not let me readjust back. Tried cleaning, turning adjustment wheel and nothing worked. Cheap product that loses functions quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grind in a bind
customer_reviews.text: When my previous grinder gave up the ghost after many years of loyal service, I was in dire need of a new grinder as my hand grinder would get old very quickly, especially while fumbling around in predawn hours. After some research I found this Secura grinder. Once setting it to the proper grind, it worked (and still works) like a champ. I am extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: madczech

customer_reviews.title: Moderate priced, and reliable, but it does not ...
customer_reviews.text: Moderate priced, and reliable, but it does not allow coarse grind, Even at lowest setting the resulting grit is uniform, but is equal in grain size to the store bought medium grinds. Not coarse, but it suffices for french press and cold brew and for hot drip methods.. Have to use some sort of a pick (eg: a pointy chop stick) to clean it out each grinding because the outflow port gets stuffed full of grinds - every - single - time. No big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bernhardi

customer_reviews.title: I think it grinds a lot finer than other grinders I've tried
customer_reviews.text: It's s decent quality for the money. However grind was hard to nail down. I think it grinds a lot finer than other grinders I've tried. I found it hard to get a good course grind for French Press.
customer_reviews.author: JellyBombBelly

customer_reviews.title: I bought a replacement and it it appears to be grinding like it did when it was new
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grinder for a little over 3 months, I use it at least once or twice a day. First, its very messy, as soon as you open the hopper lid grounds fly every where. The grind is inconsistent and worsened over time. It got to a point where it was unusable. I removed the Grind Adjustment Ring and noticed the cutting surface was totally worn down. I bought a replacement and it it appears to be grinding like it did when it was new. I'm not sure how this is getting so many 4 and 5 star ratings.
customer_reviews.author: N.Packard

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Very similar to a 14 year old La Pavoni that just bit the dust because an unrelated screw was mixed in with the beans. This one is a little quieter. It is simple and well designed and does what I need it to do. There's no reason to spend double or more for something 'fancier' that does not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Moxon

customer_reviews.title: good, quick , accurate grinding
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. The only problem I have with it is that in our very dry climate the static charge with ground coffee can cause it to stick where you don't want it too. Most times when I am pouring the grounds out of the grind catch bin, some goes where I don't want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ullrich

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter,who is like myself a coffee lover. She had bought herself one of the cheaper blade type grinders,in which she was dissatisfied with.After receiving this for Christmas from my wife and I she fell in love with this burr grinder. It's compact size and the ability to choose between several different grinds,from super fine to course. Although she hasn't used it for a long period of time yet,I believe this grinder should last her a long while. This grinder appears to be of good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G.

customer_reviews.title: Pooped out after a month
customer_reviews.text: I looked around at Burr grinders and this one seemed the best for its price, but you get what you pay for. The grinder worked well for a month and a half and now it just jams everytime I use it. It doesn't matter how well I clean it, if more than a half of cup of coffee beans is put in it jams and has to be taken apart to free the beans. Just save your money like I should have and get a good grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L Bray

customer_reviews.title: Good for French press grind
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is not as loud as my old Cuisinart grinder that I had to put to sleep. I use it for French press coffee and the grind is course enough with a few bits of fine material. A very good, compact grinder.
customer_reviews.author: James L'Etoile

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a loud yet effective compct burr grinder. I have used it for 3months and it works great. Static electricity causes beans to stck to the container....regular cleaning with a sey paper towel helps. A little messy but it makes a great cup of coffee. Smallest electric burr that I've found. Excellent buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lamont

customer_reviews.title: its messy and it only grinds the coffee fine. i would only recommend it if u would ...
customer_reviews.text: don't buy, its messy and it only grinds the coffee fine. i would only recommend it if u would use it for an electric drip coffee maker, but if u use a chemex or a french press, it is useless
customer_reviews.author: CQ

customer_reviews.title: Now it barely grinds any beans each time and the grounds it does produce are extremely uneven between coarse and fine. Definitely would not recommend this to someone else
customer_reviews.text: I'm barely into my second bag of coffee with this grinder and it has already stopped working. Also, this grinder can make quite a mess even before you take the container for ground out of the grinder--then it is a big mess. Somehow grounds are able to sneak out of the device while it is grinding. Now it barely grinds any beans each time and the grounds it does produce are extremely uneven between coarse and fine. Definitely would not recommend this to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Business Reader

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty small, works well for its size, the hopper holds enough beans for a full 12-14 cup pot of coffee. The static electricity is pretty intense- I’ve folded a piece of aluminum foil over the edge which seems to help. Over all, satisfied with this little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle Koglin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! We love it....
customer_reviews.text: This was a great investment. So easy to use and makes excellent grounds for our coffee maker. We clean it after every use which will help with the longevity of this product, but it all worth it. Set the dial and that's about it. It does all the guess work for you. We realized we were using way to much coffee with other grinders. We highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Slacker

customer_reviews.title: Fast makes up for flaws
customer_reviews.text: Definite worth the money. I am really okay with this purchase because it saves my wrists from being murdered by hand grinders! Though the grind adjuster is finiky, it still is able to make different sized grinds and is more accurate if I rock it a bit while doing it. Still, the fact that I feel the need to be there the whole time it's grinding to make sure it grinds the right size or that it doesn't get stuck is a bummer, but it's still okay cause it's a lot faster than hand grinding haha
customer_reviews.author: ChrisPy Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Secura grinder
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be a quality product and grinds very well. No initial problems after a couple of bags of beans. Overall, I am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Worked in a Pinch...
customer_reviews.text: My old grinder broke so I needed something in pinch and ordered this based on reviews. The bean hopper is exceptionally small, and the grinder itself clogged often. Most grinders create a bit of static but this one was REALLY messy, even when I tapped the bin on the counter, etc. I've already purchased a Breville Smart Grinder that performs much better (albeit a much higher cost) and this will be going into the yard sale bin.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: This coffee grinder may come at a great price point
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder may come at a great price point, but it's not worth your money. We bought this after our Baratza Encore stopped working (it ran strong for many years) and didn't want to spend a lot. A few months later, I've already ordered another Baratza so that I can get rid of this one. Here's why: 1. It's MESSY. Coffee grounds everywhere. 2. Very inconsistent grind size; not good for an espresso maker. 3. It's small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t grind yer gears...
customer_reviews.text: I’m apologize for only four stars but I’m used to a more expensive unit (that got trashed in a move) and this is just SO plastic and noisy. But, honestly, it works pretty well 4/5 well
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I can’t get a fine or even medium ground. Regardless of what setting I place this on- it’s always a very coarse ground :( I’m searching for a new one to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Maddely

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present for my brother he loves it works great is relatively quiet and fast can grind a good ...
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my brother he loves it works great is relatively quiet and fast can grind a good amount of coffee in just seconds which is wonderful if you prefer fresh ground to already ground
customer_reviews.author: Devrose

customer_reviews.title: Secura electric burr coffee grinder works well.
customer_reviews.text: The Secura has a nice compact design and runs relatively quietly, compared with the Cuisinart it replaced. The ground coffee receptacle is easy to take out and put back. The quality of the ground coffee (particle size) is easy to control and uniform in size. Price was great, providing excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: R. V. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality, Low Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on September 14, 2017 and as of this morning it is no longer functional. Initially, I found the grinder of poor quality as it failed to make the even grind that you expect out of a burr grinder. This morning, after only 3 months of daily use, the grinder came apart as it was grinding my coffee and started smoking. Don't be tempted by the popular price point, this is a waste of your money.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Berk

customer_reviews.title: electrical short
customer_reviews.text: price is affordable but, electrical short developed and grinder, if left plugged in, started to turn on and grind by its self. now the coffee grinds are large and irregular.
customer_reviews.author: A Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. We officially switched from blade to burrs. The grind is more consistent and the flavor is better because of it. However, at least this particular model, is a bit noisy and messier than the old blade grinder.
customer_reviews.author: E. Albertson

customer_reviews.title: Am totally satisfied...
customer_reviews.text: Product works as expected, and have no complaints. Some others have fussed about the static electricity - to them I say, simply be careful with removing the hopper from the mill. First: Shake the grounds from the lid into a storage container, then dump the hopper contents in; tap gently to get it all out. Static with ground coffee is a fact of life. I would recommend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Great for espresso
customer_reviews.text: If you want finely ground coffee, this is the one. Nothing else in this price range is close. It outperforms my Roncilio, a far more expensive grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Easy to Adjust, Whole Bean Reservoir Needs To Be Refilled Often
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptional value. It has been in use for a few months and appears to consistently burr grind with simple volume and grind adjustments. The only comment is that I wish that the whole bean reservoir was larger. We need to add whole beans after about 4 grinds or twice a week. But, given the value, this is a small complaint.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Macpherson

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder! I like finely ground coffee and it gives me finely ground coffee... with an even grind. I chose this grinder after reading reviews. It seemed like a good grinder at a great price. And I am very pleased. Not only do I get the grind I like (which is easy to change), I can set it to grind just what I need for my two cups of coffee I drink every morning. Which is another setting that is easy to change. Everything about it is easy and straightforward. I don't have anything to compare it to, but I'm getting everything I need from this one and it's clean, low profile and easy. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori McCarter

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this grinder for months. It does do espresso quite well whereas other cheaper machines I've tried can't get a fine enough grind. I have a Saeco Aroma espresso machine and I'm able to make beautiful velvety shots with coffee from this grinder. It's easy to clean and doesn't take up much space. I'm really happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: P. Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: It works OK
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be much easier to use as my old grinder. Unfortunately beans get stuck almost every time I use it and I have to clear it and take more time than the 55 sec it proclaims it takes to grind a load. The clean up time is equal to the clean up time of my little grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Grant

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty good if you do not plan to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is OK grinder overall. It is pretty good if you do not plan to use it for Espresso grind. But if you have more or less decent espresso machine - do not buy this grinder. The finest level of grind is still too coarse for espresso. For this reason I am returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: MarkZ

customer_reviews.title: It still works for french press but not fine enough for espresso
customer_reviews.text: Broke after about a month of daily grinds. It still works for french press but not fine enough for espresso, I ended up sucking it up to buy a $100 Capresso grinder and I am VERY happy with that purchase. Just basically threw this away.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for maybe a couple of years now and can rely on it to consistently grind a drip coffee or an espresso coffee by turning the adjustment on the side. It took some trial and error to find the grind size that I prefer for each, but it can be fine tuned to give you what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an electric burr grinder, but didn't want to pay the usual high prices. This seemed like a good possibility. It's ok. If you want this for coffee brewing methods that require a coarse grind, though, I do not recommend it. The coarsest setting is still quite fine. Also, the grind is not consistent. Even with the coarse settings, you will get some very, very fine grounds mixed in. I'm using it for a drip coffee maker, so it's working alright for that purpose. When I want a really smooth cup of coffee though, I will go back to my Hario hand grinder.
customer_reviews.author: ALProf

customer_reviews.title: Automatic Electric Burr Coffee Grinder...
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder works very well. It's a bit noisy, but the coffee is ground to an even size. The adjustments allow the user to set for the number of cups that are being made, and automatically stops when enough coffee is ground. That's a good feature, but takes a while to adjust it to your own preference, if you like your coffee extra strong, or weak.
customer_reviews.author: ucadjuster

customer_reviews.title: This does everything you'd expect it to, well - ...
customer_reviews.text: This does everything you'd expect it to, well - with one gripe... getting the grinds out of the receiving chamber is either messy, or difficult. I've gotten mostly success by shaking it back out the small hole it comes in through (into my filter) - but it doesn't get everything out. Removing the top gets coffee dust everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Silva

customer_reviews.title: Plus the fine grind does not grind fine enough for espresso
customer_reviews.text: stopped working after 1 (!) day. Plus the fine grind does not grind fine enough for espresso. I am using my old spice grinder now that grinds much finer. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save yourmoney
customer_reviews.text: Have had product for only a few months. Not all beans enter the opening for grinding., End up with only half of small amount being ground. . Instructions listed with grinder not adequate. The lock (on the grind mechanism) pops up and beans do not grind. Instructions do not even mention this part.
customer_reviews.author: JMM

customer_reviews.title: though not perfect by any means
customer_reviews.text: Static Central. Adequately even grind, though not perfect by any means. Very noisy. Very slow to grind a full batch. But the fact is, this is a low-end grinder at a cheap price - you get what you pay for, so within those confines, this lives up to what one would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Theodoropoulos

product_meta.title: Secura Electric Coffee Grinder
product_meta.description:
Burr Grinding Disc - grind coffee like the pros

Burr grinding mechanism grinds uniformly and preserves natural aroma.

17 Grind Settings allow for complete control of your coffee blend

Secura Electric Burr Grinder comes with 17 grind size selections, from extremely fine (Espresso) to coarse (French press). 



Controls for the Secura Electric Burr Grinder Quantity selection from 2 to 12 cups; On/Off button; automatic shut off.

Small Footprint 

This Automatic Burr coffee grinder takes little counter space. Always available when you need freshly ground coffee.

Dimension 6” x 4” x 8.75”.

Manufacturer’s Warranty, Built to last

1-Year Manufacturers Limited Warranty. 120V, 110 Watt motor, ETL Approved Product.
feature_bullets: Secura electric burr grinder comes with 17 grind size selection, from extremely fine (Espresso) to coarse (French press)
Quantity control dial from 2 to12 cups. On/off button, automatic shut off
Burr grinding mechanism grinds uniformly and preserve natural aroma
This automatic burr Coffee grinder takes little counter space. Always available when you need freshly ground Coffee
120V, 110watt motor. Dimension 6" x 4" x 8.75". ETL approved product

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,290 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
